Title: Code Viewer
Description: A tool for viewing and analyzing code structures.
FullDescription: The Code Viewer is a tool designed to help developers visualize and analyze complex code structures. It attempts to show dependencies between code of various categories and structure analysis, making it easier to understand and work with large codebases.

Title: Evolution Simulations
Description: Simulations of evolutionary processes in biological systems.
FullDescription: This project involves creating detailed simulations that model evolutionary processes in biological systems. It includes genetic algorithms, population dynamics, and natural selection models, allowing users to observe and study evolutionary phenomena over time.

Title: Neural Networks/AI
Description: Implementation of various neural network architectures and AI algorithms.
FullDescription: This comprehensive project encompasses the implementation of various neural network architectures and AI algorithms. It includes deep learning models, reinforcement learning systems, and natural language processing applications, showcasing a broad range of artificial intelligence techniques.

Title: AutoRPG
Description: An an attempt to make a game using blazor
FullDescription: AutoRPG is an innovative project that generates role-playing game content automatically. It includes procedural generation of maps, characters, quests, and storylines, creating unique gaming experiences each time it's run.

Title: SIC-1 in VCB
Description: Implementation of SIC-1 architecture in Visual Circuit Builder.
FullDescription: This project involves implementing the SIC-1 computer architecture using Visual Circuit Builder (VCB). It demonstrates low-level computer architecture principles and provides an interactive way to understand how computers work at a fundamental level.

Title: Night Night
Description: A bedtime horror game.
FullDescription: Night Night is a horror game designed explore a child's fear of the monster under their bed. It features 5 short chapters, each exploring a different fear, the game has been slowly taking shape over the past several years

Title: WireWorld
Description: Implementation of the WireWorld cellular automaton.
FullDescription: This project is an implementation of the WireWorld cellular automaton, demonstrating complex behavior emerging from simple rules. It provides an interactive environment to explore and experiment with cellular automata concepts.

Title: Octree Galaxy
Description: A galaxy simulation using octree data structures.
FullDescription: Octree Galaxy is an ambitious project that simulates a galaxy using octree data structures for efficient spatial partitioning and rendering. It allows users to explore a vast, procedurally generated galaxy with realistic celestial mechanics. unfortunately never went much further than seeding the galaxy, rendering nearby stars via a shader, and generating some alien races with procedurally determined traits

Title: YANA (You Are Not Alone)
Description: A multiplayer survival game.
FullDescription: YANA (You Are Not Alone) is my entry to the first game jam i competed in, it was a 2d platformer built in plain java using a double buffered canvas technique i learned watching Notch work on his entry for another game jam. The game featured wireworld-based mechanics for opening doors, unfortunately the game was not very fun or playable, and had many issues when others tried to play it.

Title: Minecraft Mod
Description: A custom mod for Minecraft.
FullDescription: This Minecraft mod adds new features and mechanics to the game, including custom blocks, items, and gameplay elements. It demonstrates proficiency in Java programming and game modding techniques. The mod featured a way to convert rotten flesh into redstone, a wireworld-based signalling system somewhat similar to redstone, which interacted with a magnet-like block that responded to a coil of this redstone-like cable, in order to provide functionality similar to ProjectE, but with values based on the blocks' frequency within the surrounding worldgen

Title: ProD Name Generator
Description: Procedural name generator for RPG characters.
FullDescription: The ProD Name Generator is a sophisticated tool that generates unique and thematic names for RPG characters using advanced procedural generation techniques. It can create names for various fantasy races and cultures.

Title: ProD Map Generators
Description: Procedural map generation tools for RPGs.
FullDescription: This project includes a suite of tools for generating procedural maps for role-playing games, including dungeons, cities, and wilderness areas. It uses advanced algorithms to create realistic and varied environments.

Title: ProDnD
Description: A digital toolset for Dungeons & Dragons.
FullDescription: ProDnD is a comprehensive digital toolset for Dungeons & Dragons, including character creation, campaign management, and virtual tabletop features. It aims to enhance the D&D experience for both players and dungeon masters.

Title: Gust
Description: A mobile game about wind and flight.
FullDescription: Gust is a visually stunning mobile game that explores the mechanics of wind and flight. It features intuitive touch controls and challenging gameplay, set in a beautifully rendered world affected by wind dynamics.

Title: Splash Paint
Description: An interactive painting application for swimming pools.
FullDescription: Splash Paint is an innovative project that turns a swimming pool into an interactive canvas. Using advanced computer vision techniques, it detects swimmers' movements and translates them into colorful visual effects on the water surface.

Title: Environment Survival
Description: An educational game about environmental challenges.
FullDescription: Environment Survival is an educational game that teaches players about environmental challenges and sustainability. Players must make decisions that affect the ecosystem, learning about the long-term consequences of their actions.

Title: Evil Clutches
Description: A game project developed during school.
FullDescription: Evil Clutches is a game project developed as part of a school assignment. It showcases game design principles, storytelling, and basic game development skills.

Title: Disk Sorter
Description: An automated system for sorting disks by color.
FullDescription: The Disk Sorter is a project that uses robotics and computer vision to automatically sort disks by color. It involves programming in assembly and demonstrates skills in automation and low-level system control.

Title: VRee Map Editor
Description: A custom map editor for VR environments.
FullDescription: The VRee Map Editor is a tool developed for creating and editing virtual reality environments. It provides an intuitive interface for designing immersive VR spaces, supporting the development of VR applications and games, this was mostly just an idea that never really got off the ground

Title: VRee Network Metrics
Description: A system for measuring and optimizing VR network performance.
FullDescription: VRee Network Metrics is a sophisticated system for measuring and optimizing network performance in virtual reality applications. It includes tools for monitoring latency, packet loss, and other critical metrics to ensure smooth VR experiences.

Title: VRee Dialogue System
Description: An advanced dialogue system for VR applications.
FullDescription: The VRee Dialogue System is a comprehensive solution for creating interactive dialogues in virtual reality applications. It supports branching conversations, character lip-syncing, and integration with VR gestures and interactions.

title: VRee SDK
fullDescription: VReeSDK is a platform on unity we built in order to host multiplayer full-body VR experiences

Title: VRee SDK3
Description: The third iteration of the VRee Software Development Kit.
FullDescription: VRee SDK3 was the latest version of the VRee Software Development Kit, providing developers with powerful tools and APIs for creating immersive VR experiences. it was made as a complete re-write of the original, but unfortunately never made it to production.

Title: VRee Offline Licensing
Description: A system for managing software licenses in offline VR environments.
FullDescription: VRee Offline Licensing is a robust system for managing software licenses in virtual reality applications, especially in offline environments. It ensures secure and flexible licensing options for VR software products.

Title: VRee License Server
Description: A centralized server for managing VRee software licenses.
FullDescription: The VRee License Server is a centralized system for managing and distributing software licenses for VRee products. It provides secure authentication, usage tracking, and flexible licensing models for VR applications.

Title: VRee BodyModel
Description: A sophisticated body tracking and modeling system for VR.
FullDescription: VRee BodyModel is an advanced system for tracking and modeling human bodies in virtual reality. It provides high-fidelity skeletal tracking from multiple sources (adapters), enabling natural and immersive VR experiences with full-body presence.

Title: VRisB
Description: A VR-based sports simulation game.
FullDescription: VRisB is an innovative virtual reality sports simulation game. It focuses on replicating the dynamics of frisbee in a virtual environment, providing players with an immersive and physically engaging experience. The project showcases advanced physics simulations and VR interaction techniques.

Title: VRee SDK2
Description: The second iteration of the VRee Software Development Kit.
FullDescription: VRee SDK2 was a significant upgrade to the original VRee SDK, introducing new features and improvements for VR development. It included enhanced motion tracking capabilities, realtime video streaming, a better licensing workflow with offline licensing support and improved tools for creating multiplayer VR experiences.

Title: Micro Transform
Description: A 64-bit transform system for precise VR positioning.
FullDescription: Micro Transform is a way to represent a full transform in a single 64-bit number, designed for positioning of body data in virtual reality environments. It allows for accurate representation of position and rotation within 2 meters of a parent object, allowing for highly compressed transfer of motion capture data and rigged models in general, Made as a working prototype, but never actually implemented

Title: Virtual Oscilloscope
Description: A real-time audio visualization tool.
FullDescription: The Virtual Oscilloscope is a tool i built in order to try to render animations like the oscilloscope music shown in the video.

Title: Distant Worlds (Elite Dangerous)
Description: An algorithm for optimizing travel routes in Elite Dangerous.
FullDescription: This project tackles the Traveling Salesman problem in the context of the game Elite Dangerous. It develops an efficient algorithm to optimize travel routes between star systems, enhancing gameplay and exploration strategies for players.

Title: Stellar Cartography
Description: A tool for visualizing and analyzing stellar catalogues.
FullDescription: The Stellar Cartography project is a tool for rendering and analyzing stellar catalogues. It provides stunning visualizations of galactic structures, unfortunately never went much further than that.

Title: COVAI
Description: Connecting the logging system of Elite: Dangerous to ChatGPT
FullDescription:
i fed the captain's log of Elite: Dangerous as an input for ChatGPT playground to let it provide commentary on gameplay events,
then fed it's responses into google Text to speech to act as an AI-driven replacement for the game's cockpit voice assistent

Title: Binding of Isaac Modding
Description: Reverse-engineering and modding tools for The Binding of Isaac.
FullDescription: This project involved reverse-engineering The Binding of Isaac game to decipher its map file format. It led to the development of modding tools that allow players to create custom content for the game, significantly expanding its modding community.

Title: Mouse Tracking Analytics
Description: A background process for analyzing mouse cursor movements.
FullDescription: This project developed a sophisticated background process for tracking and analyzing mouse cursor movements. It provides insights into user behavior and interaction patterns, useful for UI/UX research and productivity analysis.

Title: x86 Assembly Art
Description: A drawing program that generates x86 assembly code.
FullDescription: This unique project created a drawing program that saves ASCII art as x86 assembly code. It combines artistic expression with low-level programming, resulting in executable art pieces that blur the line between code and visual design.

Title: Voxel Engine Prototype
Description: A voxel-based rendering engine using raymarching techniques.
FullDescription: This project developed a prototype voxel engine using signed-distance-field raymarching techniques. It explores efficient ways to render large, detailed voxel environments, pushing the boundaries of real-time voxel graphics.

Title: 8-Dimensional Bezier Curves
Description: Exploration of high-dimensional curve interpolation.
FullDescription: This ambitious project delves into the realm of 8-dimensional bezier curves, exploring advanced mathematical concepts in computer graphics. It includes implementations for interpolating across these high-dimensional surfaces and sampling from complex geometric structures.

Title: 8-bit CPU in Cellular Automaton
Description: Implementation of an 8-bit CPU within a cellular automaton framework.
FullDescription: This project aims to build a functional 8-bit CPU inside a cellular automaton environment. It explores the intersection of low-level computer architecture and emergent systems, demonstrating how complex computational structures can arise from simple rules.

Title: Fruit Grading System
Description: C#/Blazor/WPF frontend with C++ backend for fruit grading.
FullDescription: Developed a comprehensive fruit grading system featuring a C#/Blazor/WPF frontend integrated with C++ backend components. This project involved implementing web apps for system calibration, addressing localization issues, and contributing to code modernization and improved testing methodologies.

Title: VRee Multiplayer VR Platform
Description: A comprehensive multiplayer virtual reality platform.
FullDescription: Developed and maintained C++ and C# code for a sophisticated multiplayer VR platform. Key achievements include designing and implementing network architecture using UDP/TCP protocols, creating an algorithm to package whole-body motion tracking into a single UDP fragment, and building a secure licensing system with online verification via REST API and RSA/AES encryption. The project also involved implementing tamper-proofing using blockchain hashing techniques.

Title: ProDnD Mobile App
Description: A mobile app for generating procedural battle maps for Dungeons & Dragons.
FullDescription: Contributed to the development of ProDnD, a mobile application available on Google Play Store. The app is designed to generate random, thematic battlefields for Dungeons & Dragons. Key contributions included optimizing performance for map generation, developing a service for sharing maps using steganography and QR codes, porting the app to iOS, and building a system for procedurally generating random names. The project was primarily developed using C# in Unity.

Title: Yumble - Snap the Family
Description: An interactive AR experience using Kinect camera.
FullDescription: Developed as part of a graduation project, Yumble - Snap the Family focused on creating an interactive experience where a virtual character could interact with a real player via a Kinect 3D camera. The project involved significant applied research, including aligning different camera feeds, rapid OpenGL camera feed processing, refining asset bundle workflows, and developing a pathfinding algorithm using Unity's Mecanim package in C#.

Title: Auto-ARPG Editor
Description: A Blazor-based editor for JSON files in an Auto-ARPG game.
FullDescription: Developed a Blazor-based editor for managing JSON files in an Auto-ARPG (Automatically generated Action Role-Playing Game) project. This tool streamlines the process of creating and editing game content. The project was built using C# 10/.NET 6 and utilized NuGet packages such as GdkSharp and ImageSharp.

Title: Personal Website and Webshop Hosting
Description: Self-hosted website and partner's webshop using various web technologies.
FullDescription:
Maintained a long-term personal website project, working with HTML/CSS, Bootstrap, PHP, and JEE.
Currently hosting a personal website (this one) on microsoft azure
Previously hosted on a local laptop alongside a webshop (using PrestaShop) for a partner on a self-managed Apache HTTP server.
That setup included FTP, Git, and MySQL database servers.
The project also involved configuring DNS records, SSL certificates, and implementing email security protocols (DMARC, SPF, DKIM) for a custom email address.

 Current configuration uses github actions to deploy the C#/Blazor application to microsoft Azure as a static website

Title: AI and Genetic Algorithms
Description: Various Projects exploring AI, gradient descent, and genetic algorithms.
FullDescription: A collection of Projects focused on artificial intelligence, gradient descent techniques, and genetic algorithms. These Projects, implemented in both C# and C++, explore various aspects of machine learning and evolutionary computation.

Title: Advanced Shader Projects
Description: Diverse shader Projects using GLSL, HLSL, and CG.
FullDescription:
A series of shader Projects developed using GLSL, HLSL, and CG, working with both OpenGL and DirectX.
These Projects often explore unconventional applications of shaders, including compute shaders and ray marching techniques.

Title: Audio Processing Projects
Description: Various audio-related Projects including an oscilloscope, dynamic music system and MIDI tracker.
FullDescription: A collection of audio processing Projects primarily developed in C#. Notable Projects include a custom oscilloscope for audio visualization, a MIDI tracker for music composition, and systems for dynamic audio generation and manipulation.

Title: WireWorld Cellular Automaton
Description: Implementations of the WireWorld cellular automaton in various languages.
FullDescription:
Multiple Projects exploring the WireWorld cellular automaton,
attempting to transform its rules into interesting game mechanics.
Implementations have been done in Java, C#, and even as HLSL shaders,
showcasing the versatility of this concept across different programming paradigms.

Title: Manim Animations
Description: Educational animations created using the Manim library in Python.
FullDescription: A series of educational animations developed using the Manim library in Python. These animations are designed to explain complex concepts visually, making them ideal for educational content or presentations.
